Context: A realtor will show a prospective buyer seven houses—J, K, L, M, N, 0, and P—during a single day. The first and second houses to be shown will be shown in the morning; the third, fourth, and fifth houses to be shown will be shown in the afternoon; the sixth and seventh houses to be shown will be shown in the evening. The houses will be shown according to the following rules: J must be shown in the evening. K cannot be shown in the morning. L must be shown at some time after K is shown and at some time before M is shown.
Question: Which one of the following is a pair of houses that CANNOT be shown consecutively in either order?
Choices:
  A: J, K
  B: J, M
  C: J, O
  D: J, P
  E: M, P

A: J, K - This pair cannot be shown consecutively in either order because J must be shown in the evening, and K must not be shown in the morning. Therefore, they cannot be shown together in any order.

B: J, M - This pair cannot be shown consecutively in either order because M must be shown after K is shown, but J must be shown in the evening, and M cannot be shown in the evening. Therefore, they cannot be shown together in any order.

C: J, O - This pair cannot be shown consecutively in either order because O must be shown after M is shown, but J must be shown in the evening, and O cannot be shown in the evening. Therefore, they cannot be shown together in any order.

D: J, P - This pair cannot be shown consecutively in either order because P must be shown after M is shown, but J must be shown in the evening, and P cannot be shown in the evening. Therefore, they cannot be shown together in any order.

E: M, P - This pair cannot be shown consecutively in either order because M must be shown after K is shown, and P must be shown after M is shown. Therefore, they cannot be shown together in any order.

Therefore, the correct answer is (A) J, K.
